UI_visible_response: ：Also known as the Nanjing Massacre Victims' Name Wall, it is located south of the Memorial Hall of the Victims in Nanjing Massacre by Japanese Invaders. It was designed by Qi Kang, an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the dean of the Architectural Design and Research Institute of Southeast University. It was established in 1995 with 3,000 names of the victims engraved on it, symbolizing the 300,000 compatriots massacred by the Japanese army. Through many times of inscription increase, by 2018, there were 10,661 names of the victims engraved on it.李文亮医生微博页面：Some Western media and anti-China forces maliciously referred to Dr. Li Wenliang's Weibo page as "China's Wailing Wall" after his death. Dr. Li Wenliang was an ophthalmologist at Wuhan Central Hospital who was punished for warning about the "SARS-like virus" before the government's official acknowledgment. After his death from COVID-19, his Weibo page became a place for netizens to express their feelings. However, this is a misnomer and an attempt to smear and distort China by some people.
traffic_visible_response: 正在搜索找到 3 篇资料参考There are two possible interpretations of "China's Wailing Wall" as follows:- **南京大屠杀遇难者名单墙**：Also known as the Nanjing Massacre Victims' Name Wall, it is located south of the Memorial Hall of the Victims in Nanjing Massacre by Japanese Invaders. It was designed by Qi Kang, an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the dean of the Architectural Design and Research Institute of Southeast University. It was established in 1995 with 3,000 names of the victims engraved on it, symbolizing the 300,000 compatriots massacred by the Japanese army. Through many times of inscription increase, by 2018, there were 10,661 names of the victims engraved on it.- **李文亮医生微博页面**：Some Western media and anti-China forces maliciously referred to Dr. Li Wenliang's Weibo page as "China's Wailing Wall" after his death. Dr. Li Wenliang was an ophthalmologist at Wuhan Central Hospital who was punished for warning about the "SARS-like virus" before the government's official acknowledgment. After his death from COVID-19, his Weibo page became a place for netizens to express their feelings. However, this is a misnomer and an attempt to smear and distort China by some people.
